titles.title: Education Infrastructure Act of 1994
A bill to improve the quality of public elementary and secondary school libraries, media centers, and facilities in order to help meet the National Education Goals.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4565-4569)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Education, Arts, Humanities. Hearings held.

bill.summary: 4/20/1994--Introduced. Education Infrastructure Act of 1994 - Directs the Secretary of Education to award grants to eligible local educational agencies to meet the National Education Goals through repair, renovation, alteration, and construction of public elementary or secondary school libraries, media centers, or facilities, used for academic or vocational instruction, including certain authorized activities. Sets forth requirements for: (1) maintenance of effort, supplementation of non-Federal funds, and general limitations; (2) minority small business participation as project contractors or subcontractors, and payment of wages in accordance with the Davis-Bacon Act; and (3) Federal evaluation. Authorizes the comprehensive regional centers to provide technical assistance to such projects. Authorizes appropriations.
